description: Firstly, to fix the GUI not starting, you have to manually give the file permissions; sudo chmod 666 /etc/bacula/bat.conf. I also changed it to bacula group, not sure if necessary; sudo chown bacula:bacula /etc/bacula/bat.conf. I just wanted a GUI to quickly set up multiple backup jobs. This application is not that, it seems to require backup job configuration in configuration files. I'm sure it's great for people who prefer doing configuration in text files.

The problem mentioned by others can be solved quickly and easily by adding your user to the "bacula" group - "sudo usermod -a -G bacula username" - You may in some cases have to change group permissions on the file as well to provide the bacula usergroup with more permissions.

Remember that once you have added your user to the bacula group you will have to logout and log back in again in order for the change to take effect .
summary: Works fine after adding user to the bacula group

description:
So as other comments have stated there is a little configuration needed to set this up. Which honestly once you do it and understand how Bacula works the configuration needed makes perfect sense. 

-- Configuration Instructions --
After installation you will need to adjust permissions on the bat.conf file that will be found in /etc/bacula/ . You will also need to add your user account to the bacula group.

## Change file permissions on bat.conf ##
Issue the following commands 
sudo chmod 775 /etc/bacula/bat.conf (The permissions could be a bit more restrictive, your milage will vary depending on you needs.)

## Add user to bacula group ##
sudo usermod -a -G bacula [ your username ]

Configure the bat.conf file, (Below is an example)

Director {
 Name = This needs to be the name of your director 
 DIRport = 9101
 address = This can be either ip address of hostname
 Password = "Your director password here" (Keep the quotes around the password)
}

After you have done these actions you should be all set. If you can't connect then I would assume either your director name is incorrect or the password is either wrong or you have left out or have to many quote marks.

I hope this helps people that are having issues with the software.
summary: Works good for my needs and not hard to configure
